We had an absolutely wonderful experience staying in this comfortable and stylish space! The interior design is even more stunning than in the photos—this host has excellent taste in decor and furniture. The attention to detail really made us feel at home here.
This place has got all of the amenities we could even think of and more! The kitchen is fully functional and there are plenty of dishes and kitchenware available to prepare home-cooked meals. They even left a large bag of ice in the freezer which saved us the trouble of going out to buy some when transporting groceries back home in our cooler. Major bonus points for that touch! There are not one, but two 4K Roku TVs, one in the living room and one in the front bedroom. If your travel plans include movie-watching, this is an awesome space for that! The couch and beds are very comfortable as well.
We really enjoyed observing the insect wildlife on the front porch at night—don’t worry, there were *no* bugs inside the house! If you like entomology as much as I do, you’ll love watching moths and tiny caterpillars come out to play when it gets dark. We were just mesmerized by nightly web-weaving. This was such a fascinating aspect of our stay.
If you’re looking for a homely and stylish atmosphere for your stay in Florence, this is the place for you. It is cozy, contemporary, and conveniently located only minutes away from downtown. I can guarantee that you will feel safe and at home here—I know I did. Do not hesitate to book this outstanding cottage, you will fall in love!

review_text:
We booked this home for a few days during a UNA commencement week and were pleased with the amenities and furnishings for our family. Staying on Wood Avenue is always a treat as the historic charm is second to none and so many activities and dining within walking distance! You can even hear the live lions roaring at the UNA Lion Habitat across the way, just inside the campus boundary.
We did a fair amount of cooking for family and noted the back patio does not have a barbeque grill, but the new stainless kitchen appliances are quite nice and the waterfall sink is really handy. There is plenty of countertop space, although care needs to be taken if you do any cooking, as there is no backsplash, as yet, surrounding the countertops. There is a Mr. Coffee maker, but we noted no Kuerig if that is your preference. The extra deep freeze in the utility room is a godsend for fishermen.
The home has some very nice touches with period furnishings and wall sconces with what appear to be live hydrangea bud vases with a very nice frangrance. The beds were very comfortable and rooms had adequate space for luggage and belongings. The master ensuite shower is not pictured in the listing, but beautiful, modern with farmhouse charm and the second full bath has a tub/shower combo with modern vanity and both baths are very spaceous.
Many of the rooms have arched doorways, adding to the overall character of the home. The living room has a television with many cable selections, as well as local channels and there is a cabinet with a nice selection of board and card games which our teens enjoyed.
The back entry steps are rather steep with several stairs up to the door, but the front entry is more level and a good alternative if you have knee or joint issues. We very much enjoyed the front porch. Though it is rather small, with a chair or two is so very nice in the evenings to enjoy chatting with family or friends. There is a light and a ceiling fan for cooling the area and each morning we enjoyed our coffee on the porch with a view of Wood Avenue birds, squirrels and the occaisional passerby.
Whether you are an overnight guest looking for a brief stay and dining out most of the time, or perhaps you like to cook and are looking to stay awhile, this home is charming and we'll certainly be keeping it on our list for return trips to Florence!
